title: Karen Pence To Raise Awareness For Art Therapy While Serving As Second Lady
text:
Karen Pence To Raise Awareness For Art Therapy While Serving As Second Lady "I just want to make people aware ..." by Charles Campbell February 21, 2017 at 5:56am Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Karen Pence plans to use her time as America’s second lady to raise awareness about art therapy. 
The wife of the vice president shared her thoughts about art’s potential healing abilities during an exclusive interview with the Associated Press. 
“One thing I can bring to this as second lady is making people aware of what art therapy is and how it works,” Pence said. “It’s not arts and crafts.” Advertisement - story continues below Pence ‘Disappointed’ By Flynn’s Actions, Affirms Partnership With Trump 
She added that art therapists “can do things that help the patient have a little more control.” 
Pence, a former elementary school teacher, advocated for art therapy while she was Indiana’s first lady. She was first exposed to the practice during a trip to Washington hospital over 10 years ago. 
Residents of Indiana have attested to Pence’s dedication to the cause. Advertisement – story continues below 
“Even when she was here in the state of Indiana, she was offering various grants and processing with us in our field to help others. So her being at that level definitely gives us a very much broader audience and understanding of the field to educate,” said Tami Harris, President of the Indiana Art Therapy Association. 
Pence has also observed art therapy programs in Japan, Germany, Israel and Canada. 
Even though she received a master’s degree in art education, Pence thinks art therapy wasn’t something she’d be “qualified to do.” Advertisement - story continues below Video Shows The Moment When A Fallen Soldier Makes It Home 
Although art therapy isn’t usually covered by heath insurers, Pence doesn’t feel it’s her place to try and encourage companies to provide for it. She simply wants to use her platform to bring awareness. 
“I don’t really see my role as policy maker or policy changer,” Pence said. “I just want to make people aware of what art therapy is.” 
According to the American Art Therapy Association , those specializing in the practice can expect their clients to see a wide range of health benefits. 
A statement on their website reads: “Art therapy is a mental health profession in which clients, facilitated by the art therapist, use art media, the creative process, and the resulting artwork to explore their feelings, reconcile emotional conflicts, foster self-awareness, manage behavior and addictions, develop social skills, improve reality orientation, reduce anxiety, and increase self-esteem. A goal in art therapy is to improve or restore a client’s functioning and his or her sense of personal well-being.” What do you think? Scroll down to comment below. Advertisement Popular Right Now
